SUMMARY: REQUIRED | OPTIONAL DETAIL: ELEMENT

org.androidtransfuse.annotations
Annotation Type RegisterListener

@Target(value={FIELD,TYPE,METHOD})
@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface RegisterListener

Specifies the given type, field or method return type as a listener to the identified component. This annotation triggers Transfuse to investigate the interfaces implemented by the given type. If the interfaces match any of the available listeners or Call-Through methods, the appropriate registration method will be used to make the annotated instance a listener of the component

As an example, one may register an anonymous inner class OnClick Listener as follows: 

     @RegisterListener(R.id.button)
     View.OnClickListener listener = new View.OnClickListener() {
         public void onClick(View v) {...}
     };
Likewise, one may register an injected listener the same way: 
     @RegisterListener(R.id.button)
     @Inject
     ButtonOnClickListener listener;

Author:
John Ericksen

Optional Element Summary
 Class[] interfaces
          Listener interfaces to use.
 String tag
          Resource tag used to lookup the View via the Activity.getViewByTag() method.
 int value
          Resource id used to lookup the View via the Activity.getViewById() method.
 

value

public abstract int value
Resource id used to lookup the View via the Activity.getViewById() method.

Default:
-1

tag

public abstract String tag
Resource tag used to lookup the View via the Activity.getViewByTag() method.

Default:
""

interfaces

public abstract Class[] interfaces
Listener interfaces to use. If none are specified, all Listener interfaces will be registered.

Default:
{}
